examples.code:
require "google/cloud/vision"

vision = Google::Cloud::Vision.new

image = vision.image "path/to/face.jpg"
face = image.face

face.bounds.face.count #=> 4
face.bounds.face.first #=> #<Vertex (x: 153, y: 34)>

methods.name: head
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotation
Face
Bounds#head
methods.description: The bounding polygon around the face. The coordinates of the bounding box are in the original image’s scale, as returned in ImageParams. The bounding box is computed to “frame” the face in accordance with human expectations. It is based on the landmarker results. Note that one or more x and/or y coordinates may not be generated in the BoundingPoly (the polygon will be unbounded) if only a partial face appears in the image to be annotated.

methods.name: face
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotation
Face
Bounds#face
methods.description: This bounding polygon is tighter than the #head, and encloses only the skin part of the face. Typically, it is used to eliminate the face from any image annotation that detects the “amount of skin” visible in an image. It is not based on the landmarks, only on the initial face detection.

methods.name: to_a
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotation
Face
Bounds#to_a
methods.description: Returns the object’s property values as an array.

methods.name: to_h
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Annotation
Face
Bounds#to_h
methods.description: Deeply converts object to a hash. All keys will be symbolized.
